Brazil: Hundreds of thousands of people all over Brazil protest against corruption and denounce the government of President Dilma Rousseff.
A bus plunges over a ravine in Brazil's São Paulo state, resulting in at least 18 people killed and 28 injured.
The 2016 Summer Olympics are held in Rio de Janeiro.

The Senate votes 61–20 in favor of removing Dilma Rousseff from office as President of Brazil. Current Acting President Michel Temer will serve out the remainder of the term, which ends 1 January 2019.
A wildlife sanctuary for rescued elephants opens in Mato Grosso.
Clashes between rival gangs in at least two prisons, leave at least 18 people killed.

A chartered Avro RJ85 plane carrying 77 people, including the Chapecoense football team, crashes near Medellín, Colombia. Rescuers report at least six survivors have been found in the wreckage. The 2016 Copa Sudamericana Finals are suspended. The title is later awarded to Chapecoense.
